news.title: Google pays $68M to settle claims its voice assistant spied on users
news.summary: Google did not admit wrongdoing in the settlement of the class-action case, which accused the firm of "unlawful and intentional interception and recording of individuals’ confidential communications without their consent and subsequent unauthorized disclosure of those communications to third parties

news.title: AI chip startup Ricursive hits $4B valuation two months after launch
news.summary: Ricursive joins Recursive and Unconventional AI in raising massive funds at multi-billion valuations out of the gate.

news.title: Meta to test premium subscriptions on Instagram, Facebook, and WhatsApp
news.summary: In the coming months, Meta is going to explore a premium experience on Instagram, Facebook, and WhatsApp that gives users access to special features and more control over how they share and connect, while keeping the core experiences free.

news.title: Some international attendees are skipping 2026 GDC due to safety fears and growing ICE presence
news.summary: Many members of the international games industry are skipping the 2026 Game Developers Conference because of the growing ICE presence and other concerns.

news.title: Vinod Khosla publicly disavows Keith Rabois’ comments on ICE shooting
news.summary: Unwavering Trump loyalist and VC Keith Rabois caused his colleague  and his firm's founder to distance themselves from his comments on ICE.

news.title: X faces EU investigation over Grok’s sexualized deepfakes
news.summary: X is facing an investigation from the European Commission over the sexualized deepfakes generated by its Grok AI chatbot. news.summary: Company's autodiscover caused users' test credentials to be sent outside Microsoft networks.

news.title: Apple's AirTag 2 is easier to find thanks to new chip
news.summary: This is the first major upgrade since Apple introduced AirTags five years ago.

news.title: “Wildly irresponsible”: DOT's use of AI to draft safety rules sparks concerns
news.summary: Staffers warn DOT's use of Gemini to draft rules could cause injuries and deaths.

news.title: Judge Delays Minnesota ICE Decision While Weighing Whether State Is Being Illegally Punished
news.summary: A federal judge ordered a new briefing due Wednesday on whether DHS is using armed raids to pressure Minnesota into abandoning its sanctuary policies, leaving ICE operations in place for now.

news.title: Palantir Defends Work With ICE to Staff Following Killing of Alex Pretti
news.summary: “In my opinion ICE are the bad guys. I am not proud that the company I enjoy so much working for is part of this,” one worker wrote on Slack.

news.title: TikTok Data Center Outage Triggers Trust Crisis for New US Owners
news.summary: The technical failure coincided with TikTok’s ownership transition, leading users to question whether videos criticizing ICE raids in Minnesota were being intentionally censored.

news.title: Redditors Are Mounting a Resistance Against ICE
news.summary: A user from r/Minneapolis was among the first to share footage of federal agents shooting Alex Pretti. Following his death, subreddits about football, cats, and embroidery have all rallied against ICE.
